intro: Psychotria pumila var. leuconeura, commonly known as the white-veined Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with distinctive white veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. This variant is often found in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests.
